result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kelly A Mathieu was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all fines, costs, supervision fees and any cost of treatment during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to pay all fines, costs, supervision fees and any cost of treatment during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of governmental entities for the balance due.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Submit to Random Testing.
Follow through with any counseling deemed appropriate.
Attend Victim Impact Panel
Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: State appears by Attorney Patti Wabitsch. Defendant Kelly Mathieu in court, in custody with Attorney Daniel Grable. State has reviewed pre-sentence investigation. Counsel has reviewed pre-sentence investigation. State makes recommendation. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing on March 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kelly A Mathieu in court with attorney Daniel S. Grable.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties in receipt of PSI. State will not be amending the pretrial offer. Defendant has not reviewed the PSI with her attorney. Court sets matter over for 3/18/15 at 10:30am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Scanned and forwarded to Br. 1, copies to D.A. and Atty. Grable
received from defendant,   Scanned and forwarded to Br. 1
Sentencing hearing on March 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kelly A Mathieu in court with attorney Daniel S. Grable.  Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant and finds her guilty. On motion of the State, Ct. 2 dismissed. At time of sentencing, State will recommend 4 yrs prison with 2 yrs initial confinement and 2 yrs extended supervision, fine of $4500, 36 mo revocation, 36 mo ignition interlock, AODA with Victim Impact Panel. However, if State reviews PSI  they may change their offer to a lessen sentence. Court orders a presentence investigation and adjourns sentencing.
received from Atty. Grable with attached sentencing letters,  forwarded to scanning.
